bow: feeding question first time mom firstly hello mommit first time mom to child of my own have step son but this will be my first biological child due april 11th and trying to figure out things as growing 26 years old and have been married for years at anyrate went through some pretty traumatic abuse as kid and though ve worked through most all of it and work on it on regular basis there is one thing with motherhood can not stomach and ve known it for long time breast feeding know know ve read how beneficial it is and no pumping is an option for me either that being said please do judge too much although welcome well placed advice trying to get information from mom who ve bottle formula fed from the start how do you approach that with doc how to start and deal with it at the hospital what formula is the best to start with really want to know from some women who ve been there if possible or if you know someone who took this approach but again any advice is welcome it nobody business how you feed your child and why you should probably be prepared for some criticism though some subtle and some open breastfeeding moms get it too you ca win either way really first off congratulations will preface this with saying am supporter advocate of breastfeeding but realize that all circumstances are different and we all want to do what is best for our family it helps that you already know what you want do not feel that you have to explain your situation or decision to anyone you will constantly be given surveys by formula companies asking you if you are planning on formula feeding or bfing always put bfing because you will get more free cans of formula had multiple cases appear at my doorstep in hopes that would give up and formula feed also got many coupons monthly this will give you variety of formulas to try if you have problems finding one that works then once you find one see if there is someone you know that would be willing to swap containers for the ones that you do use in the hospital they will probably give you something that most babies tolerate such as similac advanced would just start with what your baby gets at the hospital and change it if you see any issues such as gas or allergies do not recommend stocking up on formula because if for some reason you ca use that particular brand most stores will not allow unopened cans to be returned found that out the hard way as for bringing it up with your doctor there really no need just ask how to ensure your milk either does not come in or is stopped as soon as possible you will probably become engorged and my best solutions is to put frozen cabbage leaves on your breasts when they feel full it not only relieves the pain but will inhibit milk production also invest in small box of nursing pads to stop leaking problems http www reddit com mommit comments 1ppzx6 benefits of breast feeding this was my personal post from last night first off was unable to produce enough for breastfeeding the first couple of days after my son was born then unable to entirely after my son was days old the hospital started him on enfamil a+ ready to serve we kept him on that pricey pricey for about months he had terrible gas pains that would have him shrieking we switched to enfamil a+ gentle ease powder and since then we have not had single gas pain he almost months old now we had lot of success with that formula we use the playtex ventaire bottles have three kids first one was so amped up to breastfeed we started out good but week after delivery was back in the hospital with an infection pumped and dumped while there and he was given bottles had zero support besides my husband pumped and supplemented what had to for weeks before going all formula no one cared much then years ago and the hospital even pushed formula second time wanted to breastfeed and did until we had family emergency my mom almost died less than month after having my son was overwhelmed depressed and felt like failure my baby needed to be supplemented and did want to introduce bottles so we would feed him by syringe developed ppd pretty bad stopped breastfeeding again at about weeks ppd stuck around for what seemed like forever because could come to terms that failed yet again third baby already was in therapy and knew before delivered he would be formula baby but there was still some guilt made the choice to breastfeed for the days while in the hospital and switch over when we got home seen midwife this last time around and only one of the nurses was kinda bitch about me switching and at my six week checkup they wanted to know why wasnt breastfeeding every other nurse was really supportive when stated that knew breast was best but its not for me even the his doctor did question why was formula feeding knew if tried and failed again it would be worse for me and what the baby needs was happy mommy and formula feeding made me happy any future babies for husband and will probably be breastfeed for the first few days and then switched over my kiddos are pretty darn healthy can count on one hand how times the older two have been sick and needed antibiotics everyone is different no matter what you do someone will disagree with your choices its part if parenthood hey my philosophy is happy mum happy baby if you choose to do something or not to do something then it is up to you breast fed for months then combi fed for then formula only after that did this because its what wanted to do and it suited me did get stressed and so it did affect baby where as if have listened to others have been tormented and would have found live difficult those that are around you should support you no matter what had supply issues and needed to supplement our pediatrician recommended enfamil and that was what the hospital provided us with as well sure your pediatrician will have an opinion though would worry about how to approach it with the doctor if when he brings it up just tell him what you told us at the hospital they ll be used to dealing with formula feeding moms too and if anyone is judgemental about it just tell them what you told us then make point of telling their supervisor all about it formula fed from the start as motorbike accident left me having chest reconstruction that made me unable to breast feed did run up against few people who scorned me for not breast feeding but at the end of the day if you cant you cant there is no right or wrong formula every baby will like different one and at weeks my baby suddenly became intolerant to the one she had been getting since birth so we had to change it get few bottles to start with yes it will mean cleaning one as soon as its used but babys also differ on which bottle they like so dont go buying 12 until you know baby likes that brand of bottle make sure you only keep one brand of bottle once you know which they prefer because there is nothing worse than playing hunt the bottle cap at 3am when the little ones screaming we got an electric steam sterilizer and it was brilliant highly recommend them as for all this make sure baby takes xozs baby will take what it wants to take no more no less winding 22 pats top of the back middle of the back bottom of the back keep doing it until they burp you will know trust me oh and put towel or cloth over your shoulder when you do it what else have change bags and when you take one out make sure the one you leave at home is fully stocked too used to refill my nappy stash in my bag as soon as got back having prepped and ready will cover you in case of emergency long journeys or side trips dont know what country you are in but in the uk you can get premeasured multi compartment contains for formula powder that you just tip into the sterilised water filled bottle as you need it my baby liked it room temperature so dont worry about warming it try it unwarmed first dont pressure yourself dont listen to all the well would do this if it were my baby its your baby while people can give practical advice like keep pack of wet wipes in the fridge as well as one at room temperature you will know your baby better than they do and you will learn what cry means what and ho they like to sleep you will be fine oh yeah go online and go to all the nappy diaper brand sites and all the formula sites and every baby club run by supermarket you can find you will get free samples and vouchers galore had your mindset about breast feeding when gave birth to my son four months ago was in the delivery room having contractions with an oxygen mask on my face when one of the nurses asked me if planned to formula feed or breast feed immediately said formula because that had always been my plan my husband talked to me though and asked me just to try breast feeding and if could do it for any reason then we could switch to formula so gave it try and here am four months later ebfing maybe just give breastfeeding try before you delve into formula even little bit helps your baby tremendously but if you ca stand the idea then that alright too deleted do stock up on too many of one type of bottle babies can be picky about this that being said we love the playtex ventaire they are easy to clean and easy to put together and we have had very few gassy days so sorry you felt like failure because of not being able to breast feed that is what annoys me about pushing breast feeding so hard on women never breast fed my son once and never felt any guilt whatsoever he is an incredibly healthy smart child made post about the benefits of breast feeding and got only comments about breast is best imo just think there are so many other factors that go into play with children health that women should be pressured to breast feed if that not what they want in my experience that bit about telling formula companies that you are planning on breast feeding is incorrect my sister and were pregnant at the same time and we signed up for all the formula and diaper clubs together she ticked the box for formula and ticked it for breast feeding received backpacks and diaper bags including coupons for formula but no samples she received samples from every formula company why should she seek out professional help regarding breast feeding deleted op stated that she has worked through most of it and is continuing to work through it but she does not want to breast feed and that is an entirely reasonable choice especially given her past so why should she seek help to do so thank you that very good to hear at least know it comes from both sides everything have filled out so far has not asked one way or the other did get given some instant feed bottles from my ob but they expired already lol they also gave me bunch of other stuff that came from enfamil and such like bottle cooler will def remember the cabbage leaf trick and also ask my doctor the best way to stop it taking no nonsense stance on it that this is what want have great insurance so if do agree with or feel comfortable with my doctor will switch since they have made me put down which want yet maybe that ll change things already get oodles of coupons and such because freebie hunter and used to get the coupons for friends also get neat ones from places like buybuy baby and burlington kids maybe they wo make me pick lol thank you ll remember that you are also the second person on here to say the ventaire bottles are good seen good reviews on those other places too sorry you were unsuccessful that sucks if it what you want to do agree about the pressure to breast feed some women just ca for their own reasons and some it just physically does match up that not your fault and it no bueno that you had to feel that way the hospital delivering at is very progressive and super awesome so hopefully the staff will be understanding those around me do thankfully and my husband is on board with my choices because well he wants me to be comfortable and happy like you said that pretty important just read and article in smithsonian where they were saying babies spike in stress from hearing parents fight can imagine they know if you re depressed to me being happy is important for baby to be happy too if any other mothers in the hospital want to impart their opinion without provocation ll find kind way to tell them to stuff it lol do like people who feel the absolute need to but in and tell others what they think you are doing wrong as parent your way is everyone way and just because you do like it does mean jack squat again advice is one thing pushing is another and have never given adverse parenting opinions without provocation from the parent as for the nurses and such hope so said farther up the hospital is pretty progressive and awesome so hoping they ll be understanding hi mama congratulations on your pregnancy do know about formula brands but here is some info about how to soothe pain of enforcement after delivery and how to decrease supply frozen cabbage leaves cut out hole for the nipple and icing are definitely helpful if doc offers you medication to stop lactation be very skeptical good luck with it all http www lactationconsultant info dryup html at my hospital they asked formula or breastfeeding you do owe them any explanations and doubt they ll try to pressure you but have quick response ready anyway such as not comfortable breastfeeding or whatever you feel comfortable sharing not sure how hospitals handle formula bottles so it might be worth asking when you do the hospital tour in my experience the hospital has their protocol and your ob is involved with your child after the delivery your pediatrician might be better source of advice either way have relative or close friend available for last minute shopping the week after delivery for last minute purchases such as formula bottles stool softener pads etc thank you sure the mom instincts will kick in and ll know good ways to cope and might even depart from anything have planned never know did not have good parents and just want to do it well and give my child good home where they feel safe secure and loved honestly have bought any baby things yet at all for two reasons do know what it going to be and yes we are finding out two the baby is not going to waltz in tomorrow demanding diapers and formula and it makes complete sense not to stockpile thanks for the tip on the bottles too was going to buy bunch of different kinds but maybe one at time is good idea given the bottle tip mismatch at am lol been workin on this first thing you should do is check your hospitals policies if its baby friendly hospital you need to level with them your nurses drs about being sexual abuse survivor this means make sure it goes on your birth plan that you do not wish to breastfeed and anything the medical people might do during the birth that you would find triggering this is the sort of thing that would be helpful for your medical team to know if its not baby friendly hospital not breastfeeding is less likely to be contentious issue while in hospital either way make or ask for sign stating formula feeding no discussion please to stick on your door or chart etc once you are in your pediatricians care presumably you can interview and find one that you can talk to the other advice on not getting all one type of bottle is good would also add just buy the big bottles right off babies need very little to start off might want to look into newborn stomach volumes good luck second mention of this putting on good to know list well that great for you and who knows it may come out differently but want to try to have plans thank you am still working through it but it was years of systemic abuse not something you can really erase quickly ll be in therapy for very long time ve not had too many physical issues with it this is one of the only ones it about boundaries and while doing my best to get past that rather than try to push through it it seems that formula feeding is just as adequate for baby so why put myself and the baby through it deleted work at an ob gyn and while they do encourage breast if you are decided to bottle feed the doctors will not question that you will get plenty of freebies from the formula companies and suggest signing up for all of the freebies you can get as it gets expensive congratulations am very pro breastfeeding in general but at the same time respect every mother right to determine how to best feed her baby if you approach your child with dread amp negative feelings think baby will pick up on that encourage you to continue to work on your own recovery continue to work on mine and reading some of your other responses it sounds similar but not to the detriment of your relationship with your little one agree with this again why put myself and my child through it if do expressly have to ll give that read thank you must remember to stock up on cabbage lol thanks yeah my husband will be on hand and my neighbor is pretty helpful and has pseudo adopted me so both will sure be on hand for anything needed during my stay am having section and have already discussed the hospital is pretty progressive and it was just put up in 2007 my doc is 33 and most of the staff is younger in nature large part of the reason did that is because of the fact that feel people closer to my age understand things like this better it does suck but at the end if the day we are feeding our babies please do let anyone judgements get to you used to cringe having people look at me when took out bottle and god forbid they asked me felt like such failure now it none of their business what happened it is what it is and my baby is just fine and happy on formula you are doing what actually get to be stay at home mom with stay at home dad do anticipate any ppd nither does my doc but know it is possibility the ob knows full well what happened which is also why he okayed scheduled birth instead of vbac because he knows it will be more comfortable for me and because it what wanted really do appreciate your kind words and glad to see others who ve been through bad things being great parents am freebie hound always have been already on it lol thank you and agree think the best thing is for me to be as comfortable and relaxed about the situation as possible and my sweetie will follow suit had section due to breech baby and other complications the one thing that surprised me was how defensive felt when they called it an elective section *knew* that the only options were emergency and elective but was still surprised at my gut emotional reaction perhaps it because on the day of the surgery about people had to ask the same questions to make sure that they did make any people if you re breast feeding or formula feeding and know that you are being asked repeatedly because it is hospital protocol for every nurse doctor anesthesiologist whatever to ask you the same questions not because they are judging your choice when was pregnant my doctor said to do that and that you tend to get more samples was even at baby expo and one of the formula booths tried to give only add stress later you re doing what best for you and your family any pediatrician you decide to go to should not judge you and in my experience wo let them know bc my pedia gave me formula cans every time went tried bfing and my supply was low and in conjunction with working at the time it just was worth the stress it comes easy for some not so much for others and for variety of reasons you will probably be judged at some point but if it is your feeding choices you ll be judged for something else it goes with the mommy territory the main thing is do what best for you and build your own confidence that the only sure thing to fight judgement another tip since am expecting as well in feb am already getting formula coupons and they will be expired by the time deliver in the interest of not stocking up as mentioned before enfamil told me that if keep all the expired coupons til after deliver and return them together they will replace them with good ones good luck good to know for whatever reason signed up for the coupons and have gotten like any and that was back in september maybe need to call and make sure it went in right signed up at the doctors office for enfamil and similac you can sign up on both their websites have gotten more from enfamil than similac but maybe one had my due date wrong check out the ingredients in the different formulas for the most part theyre very similar but remember reading that similac stuffs their formula full of artificial sweetener which the infant grows accustomed to and will refuse non sweet foods dont know this for sure but see what info you can find about it also you owe no one an explanation just ask what type of formula they provide and say that you ll ne using formula if they ask about it give them short precise answer that says youre not interested and end of discussion both bfing moms and ffing moms get some kind of judgement at some point its not their business ignore the crazy and they ll eventually go away or you can embarass them by making scene and acting the victim might make them tthink twice about wearing their judgy pants out in public with cadense do dismiss the possibility of your feelings changing after birth prepare best for formula feeding from the start have the equipment know how to clean it and which intervals whatever else there is to learn but if you should develop feeling like mentally now prepping hard is the best thing can do so you are right wo ignore the possibility but will do everything can to prepare for how feel now no one really knows how they will react after the baby is born some women are completely happy with being pregnant and still end up with ppd you just do know humans are unpredictable as are emotions hormones and situations ve learned that all too well do know why medically indicated sections are still labeled elective rather than just scheduled or god forbid medically necessary guess their main concern is distinguishing the emergencies from the non emergencies still be calling it scheduled section if were you it not just similac all formulas use some form of artificial sweetener unless they are organic and pretty sure at this point all the brands have their own line of organic formula as well it worth pointing out though that even with the artificial sweeteners formula is still less sweet than breastmilk it does result in baby that refuses non sweet foods my daughter was combination fed still nurses bit but she looooves herself some veggies she wo eat seafood which is generally on the sweet side but she ll steal the spinach garnish off my seafood cannelloni young palates are much more sensitive than adult ones which is why they can stand to eat cardboard os mean cheerios and when they start exploring solid food anything different from the milk formula they ve been drinking is exciting so it easy to encourage love of veggies and healthy foods regardless of what they started out drinking ca find the article read so going off memory from year ago do remember it saying that yes there sweetener in all formulas but there was more in one of the similac varieties we used enfamil since my daughter was failure to thrive beginning to think that she likes the flavors of veggies but not the textures after year of trying to get her to eat carrots in varying forms pureed some we did baby led weaning so we did do purees and she ate the hell out of them so off to the races with purees and smoothies at 20 months old am because even my insurance is viewing it as elective because it covered elective section are consistently not covered by insurance it probably for ease of use by doctors like you said but still craptacular but please look into steam steriliser they are quick easy and no chemicals good luck my sister physician and she is currently pumping exclusively for her baby but hates it in fact she thinking about quitting pumping in few months when baby is months old despite tons of research saying breast is best she thinks it bunch of propaganda because she pretty much sees equal amounts of sick kids who were breastfed or formula fed and did see much difference formula is not poison and being happy and healthy mommy is best for your baby absolutely plan on it ve found they are as expensive as you would think they would be and it would be super handy to have around good to know my research so far has led me to believe it either or do see anything definitive one side over the other with where we are in technology it seems to me the engineered stuff is just as good again like you said the more comfortable am the more comfortable baby is going to be think we paid £20 for ours and it was so much nicer than using the milton sterilising tablets we also got one of those nappy wrapper bins best purchases we got in my experience doctors just ask if you re breastfeeding or formula feeding and that that not really something to approach though half breastfeed half formula feed so suppose it always possible you ll get judgey doctor who wants to lecture you on the benefits of breastfeeding hopefully not though we started lo on similac newborn formula then the doctor wanted her on the high calorie stuff because she was premie but it made her constipated you should get lot of free samples sign up for formula companies mailing lists so just try em out and see what lo likes sidenote target brand emulates enfamil brand and believe costco brand emulates similac brand we get target formula it sooooo much cheaper very good to know thank you so much read that the target brand diapers are the best too they even beat huggies in almost every test ve seen for absorbency found that totally bizarre and awesome yeah we also use target brand diapers we ve used huggies and pampers as well but target ones seem just as good and they re the cheapest exactly ll probably get grab bag but think the up amp up is probably what we ll end up with if the baby cool with it target actually has few different generic versions of the different brand name formulas they have that is similar to similac another for enfamil etc we used the generic similac one and actually preferred it over the brand name it mixed easier and had less bubbles after shaking mixing also on the back of the can of target formula there should be phone number for the manufacturer you can call and get coupons sometimes target has sales or deals on the formula too like buy so many cans and get 10 gift card like the target diapers and that what we used for long time after got too lazy for cloth diapers but recently switched to the diapers that aldi discount grocery store sells and they work just as well 27 count think it 27 pack of size cost 99 we have aldi around here but probably would opt for those early on my step son was extremely sensitive to all of the things apparently and had to have certain kinds of diapers lotions and soaps when he was young and both and my so have sensitive skin we ll just have
